data.title: Siebel Systems
data.meta_description: Company:Siebel Systems, Information technologies, CRM, Larry Ellison, IDC, Oracle, AMR Research, SAP, USA
data.text:
History

Rumors about sale of Siebel were spread in IT community from the moment of departure of the chief executive of the company Mike Lawrie. The head of Oracle Larry Ellison entered Siebel in the list of future acquisitions even during fight for merger of PeopleSoft.

In September, 2005 it became known that the Oracle company purchased the competitor Siebel Systems for $5.8 billion Oracle paid $10.66 for one stock Siebel. After the message about purchase of share of Siebel on Nasdaq grew by $1.22 up to $10.35, and Oracle â€” fell to $0.27 up to $13.01.

The management of Oracle hopes that acquisition will allow the company to receive 4 thousand corporate clients and 3.4 million users of CRM systems.
